title: Full stack Engineer
description:
We are looking for a Full-stack Engineer to join our AI & Tech team and build together the next generation of AI products and AI Agents. You will have a protagonist role in shaping the future of Hypertype and bringing us to the moon and beyond. Ready to change the European AI startup scene?

**Company description**


Hypertype is an AI-powered text based communication platform that finds the most relevant information and writes smarter customer emails & live chats, using real-time company data.


305 billion emails sent and received every single day. We live in an information overload era, with ever-changing customer scenarios to process and answer. Customer facing roles still spend 20-30 mins just to find the right answers and draft high quality email, connecting the dots from millions of data sitting inside their company. Our vision is to make the smartest experience for customer communications with data.


Only a single digit % of SMEs has adopted AI in their customer facing teams. We have over 200 paying companies including Mynt, Yazen, Remote and many more.


Our customers proudly recognize us for delivering the "highest quality answers in the market... outsmarting Gemini, Fin, Microsoft Copilot etc". —a testament to our unwavering commitment to excellence and precision in every interaction.


Join us on our mission to build the world’s smartest and most accurate AI brain across customer domains and beyond. If you're driven and ready to contribute to something groundbreaking, this is your chance to be part of a mission that is setting new industry standards.

**The Position**


You are a Full-Stack Engineer with a special passion for the Frontend, but also experience in Backend API design. And what’s more, an ambitious person that is willing to build the next European AI Unicorn.


You love to bridge the gap between design and code to bring ideas to life at the highest speed and are always learning the latest technologies and diving into the newest design trends. No technology or programming language can beat you and you deliver iterative value in no time.

* Owner mindset. Responsible for building easy-to-use and interactive experiences in a fast-paced startup environment.
* Delivery mindset. This will not be a 9 to 5 job but an intense, fun and rewarding journey like no other.
* Passion for high quality code that serves the highest standards of maintainability and readability.
* An artistic eye to bring ideas into life through fast-paced prototyping iterations.
* Working with APIs and AI solutions that will be served from our backend systems.
* Deep compromise with code visibility and performance as well as with an ambitious testing coverage.
* Passion to go the extra mile together with the whole Hypertype team!
* Drive to bring new ideas and concepts to the table in our discussions.
* Collaborating with engineers and co-founders to align technical decisions with business goals.
* Participate in all phases of the development lifecycle, from planning and design to building, testing and deploying.

**Qualification**

* +2 years experience in Frontend Engineering with proficiency in Next.js, React.js, Typescript, HTML and CSS.
* Experience building complex animations and responsive applications.
* Experience with User Interface and User Experience design.
* Experience with Python and FastAPI.
* Versatile Software Engineering Skills: A solid engineering background with a robust foundation in software engineering principles. You have written code for and supported production engineering systems.
* Experience building Chrome Extensions and packaging your Frontend applications to production.
* Experience building tests to automatically test the code.
* Experience with Docker, Git, CI/CD pipelines and cloud services (GCP, AWS, ...)
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Interaction Design, Human Computer Interaction, or a related field. A Master’s degree is a plus.

**Bonus points**

* Experience working with Redux.
* Experience working with streams and asynchronous solutions.
* Experience with Go for Rust for high performance systems.
* Experience with Mobile or Desktop development.

**The Offer**

* Opportunity to be part of an early and extremely promising startup. The right place at the right time.
* A role and position that gives you the freedom to develop your skills and persona the way you want.
* Take part of our journey as we grow to be at the forefront to solve AI challenges and work towards AGI.
* Competitive salary + stock option + opportunity to grow in the role


At Hypertype, we look for positive, 'always learning' and humble personalities. The bottom line is that you should be bright and have grit. We welcome everyone to apply if you feel it suits you and let’s have a chat to see if you could be right for the role :)

title: Sr. Talent Acquisition Partner
description:
About Us:

Rivian is on a mission to keep the world adventurous forever. This goes for the emissions-free Electric Adventure Vehicles we build, and the curious, courageous souls we seek to attract.  

As a company, we constantly challenge what’s possible, never simply accepting what has always been done. We reframe old problems, seek new solutions and operate comfortably in areas that are unknown. Our backgrounds are diverse, but our team shares a love of the outdoors and a desire to protect it for future generations.
Company Statements:
#### **Equal Opportunity**


Rivian is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender expression, gender identity, genetic information or characteristics, physical or mental disability, marital/domestic partner status, age, military/veteran status, medical condition, or any other characteristic protected by law.  

Rivian is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for persons with disabilities. If you have a disability or limitation, such as those covered by the Americans with Disabilities Act, that requires accommodations to assist you in the search and application process, please email us at candidateaccommodations@rivian.com.#### **Candidate Data Privacy**


Rivian may collect, use and disclose your personal information or personal data (within the meaning of the applicable data protection laws) when you apply for employment and/or participate in our recruitment processes (“Candidate Personal Data”). This data includes contact, demographic, communications, educational, professional, employment, social media/website, network/device, recruiting system usage/interaction, security and preference information. Rivian may use your Candidate Personal Data for the purposes of (i) tracking interactions with our recruiting system; (ii) carrying out, analyzing and improving our application and recruitment process, including assessing you and your application and conducting employment, background and reference checks; (iii) establishing an employment relationship or entering into an employment contract with you; (iv) complying with our legal, regulatory and corporate governance obligations; (v) recordkeeping; (vi) ensuring network and information security and preventing fraud; and (vii) as otherwise required or permitted by applicable law.  

Rivian may share your Candidate Personal Data with (i) internal personnel who have a need to know such information in order to perform their duties, including individuals on our People Team, Finance, Legal, and the team(s) with the position(s) for which you are applying; (ii) Rivian affiliates; and (iii) Rivian’s service providers, including providers of background checks, staffing services, and cloud services.  

Rivian may transfer or store internationally your Candidate Personal Data, including to or in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom, and the European Union and in the cloud, and this data may be subject to the laws and accessible to the courts, law enforcement and national security authorities of such jurisdictions. **Please note that we are currently not accepting applications from third party application services.**

title: Senior Consultant , Organizational Change Management
description:
**The Company**  

Cognizant (NASDAQ:CTSH) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process outsourcing services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey (U.S.), Cognizant has over 340,000 employees as of January 2024. Cognizant is a member of the NASDAQ-100, the S&P 500, the Forbes Global 1000, and the Fortune 500 and is ranked among the top performing and fastest growing companies in the world.  

Cognizant Consulting  

At Cognizant, our consultants orchestrate the capabilities to truly change the game across strategy, design, technology and industry/functional knowledge to deliver insight at speed and solutions at scale. Our consulting services elevate the unique abilities and business aspirations of customers and employees and build relationships based on trust and value.

**Role Overview**

* You will support the growth of Cognizant’s Organizational Change Management consulting business by:
* Delivering outstanding change management consulting engagements
* Contributing to business development by spotting new consulting opportunities, cultivating client relationships, and supporting development of proposals and RFP responses.
* Supporting our team's growth by guiding and empowering team members and creating an inclusive, diverse, and supportive work environment that fosters professional development
* Crafting creative change management propositions that cater to our clients' needs and align with the latest market trends
* Upgrading your own skills through continuous learning and development opportunities and sharing your insights within our company and the industry to shape our thought leadership

**Skills & Experience**

* Fluent Swedish or other Scandinavian language skills essential
* Experience, preferably in a role as (an external) organizational change management consultant.
* Proven track record of delivering successful transformational change consulting engagements at international corporations

**Desirable**

* MBA/MSc in Business Administration, Engineering, Economics, Organization Psychology, or Behavioural Science
* Experience with implementing leading technology platforms like SAP S/4HANA, Oracle, Salesforce, Workday, SuccessFactors, MS365, ServiceNow
* Experience from Cloud Migrations, Business Process Outsourcing or Mergers and Acquisitions (M&A).
* Change Management Certified Professional e.g. PROSCI or ACMP
* Deep understanding of the latest organizational change management trends
* Strong affinity with (digital) technology
* Financial Services background

**Soft Skills**

* Dynamic team player who enjoys collaborating with diverse and international teams
* Skilled in business development and building long-term relationships with clients
* Dedicated to supporting the growth and development of the practice and its team members
* Strong communication and presentation skills
* Outstanding people person with strong relationship skills, able to interact seamlessly with different levels in a global multi-cultural organization
* Location: Stockholm, Sweden.
* Hybrid working mode applies, occasional travel can be required.
company_addresses: 500 Frank W. Burr Boulevard Teaneck, NJ 07666
company_description: Cognizant helps companies modernize technology, reimagine processes and transform experiences so they stay ahead in a fast-changing world.

title: Regional Director, Cyber Security Business Growth (Northern Europe)
description:
**Our Purpose**

*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*

**Title and Summary**


Regional Director, Cyber Security Business Growth (Northern Europe)
Services are a key differentiator for Mastercard, delivering cutting-edge solutions that help our customers grow. Built on data-driven technologies and innovation, our offerings span consulting, loyalty and marketing programs, business experimentation, and information and risk management. Today, Mastercard has evolved into a comprehensive technology and services platform, expanding into security, loyalty, personalisation, and advanced data analytics to help banks, merchants, and governments deliver smarter, more secure, and highly personalised customer experiences.  

  

  

  

Security in particular is a core part of this mission, and Mastercard has grown into a leading global cybersecurity vendor. With the rise of digital commerce, security challenges have become more complex. Cyber threats now extend beyond individual transactions to entire digital ecosystems, requiring a broader approach to protection. Recognising this, Mastercard strengthened its cybersecurity offerings through strategic acquisitions, beginning with Risk Recon in 2019 and more recently Recorded Future, a global leader in threat intelligence. These additions enable Mastercard to offer solutions such as advanced cyber risk assessment and real-time threat intelligence, helping clients safeguard their entire digital footprint—not just the payments themselves.  

  

  

  

About the Role
  

  

The Regional Director, Cyber Security Business Growth will lead the growth of Mastercard’s Cyber business in the Northern Europe region. As the P&L owner, you will drive strategic growth, commercial success, and profitability — building a high-performing sales organisation while engaging directly with clients to expand our cybersecurity footprint.  

  

  

  

Responsibilities
  

  

Build & Oversee the GTM Operating Model
  

  

* Define a collaborative operating model with clear joint account coverage.
* Align sales and business development teams under a unified Mastercard Cyber narrative and sales process.

  

Coordinate Internal Execution Across Teams
  

  

* Facilitate client introductions across business lines, driving cross-sell opportunities between Recorded Future, RiskRecon, and Consulting.
* Oversee sales enablement, including collateral, pitch decks, training, and pipeline visibility.
* Align product, sales, customer success, and marketing teams around launches and revenue goals.

  

Lead Specialist Cyber Sales
  

  

* Own end-to-end sales execution, with emphasis on consulting bundles.
* Drive Recorded Future and RiskRecon referrals for Mastercard-managed accounts.

  

Performance & Continuous Improvement
  

  

* Track and report on commercial integration progress, lead funnel health, and conversion efficiency.
* Identify integration risks, take corrective actions, and communicate progress clearly to stakeholders.

  

  

Required Qualifications
  

  

Commercial & Consulting Expertise
  

  

* Successful tenure at a top-tier strategy consultancy with proven ability to translate complex cybersecurity and consulting concepts into clear, compelling client narratives.
* Extensive client-facing experience, from needs assessment through solution design and delivery of high-impact consulting and technology engagements.
* Strong business development track record — identifying opportunities, crafting proposals, scoping solutions, and driving them to closure.
* Skilled at building trust-based, long-term relationships with stakeholders at all levels, from mid-management to the C-suite.

  

Cybersecurity Expertise
  

  

* Industry savvy, understanding emerging cyber trends and creatively leveraging market opportunities.
* Working experience with sales of security services, consulting and/or technologies such as cyber threat intelligence, security awareness and training, cloud security, crisis and incident response management, third party risk management, threat and vulnerability management, security in disruptive technologies such AI - Artificial Intelligence, CRQ – Cyber Risk Quantification, web application firewall, and identity theft protection.

  

Leadership & Stakeholder Management
  

  

* Demonstrated success leading cross-functional initiatives and aligning diverse stakeholders.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making.
* Ability to influence senior leaders and drive alignment without formal authority.
* Skilled at balancing strategic vision with hands-on execution.
* Comfortable working in fast-paced, dynamic environments with shifting priorities.

  

  

Preferred Qualifications
  

  

* Experience with the application of information security standards and good practices (such as PCI-DSS, HIPAA, ISO27001, NIST, CIS, CSA).
* Experience with payment ecosystem security: understanding of security needs of traditional financial services customers e.g. Acquirers, Processors, Issuers and customers from other related segments e.g. merchants, SMB, and government.
* Experience in managing P&L responsibility or similar business ownership roles, with a focus on growth and profitability.

**Corporate Security Responsibility**

  

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

title: Test Manager
description:
**Join our Team**
-----------------


**About this opportunity**


Grow your career with us! If you are interested in test, strategies, and a challenging technical leadership career, you've come to the right place. Product Engineering Group RAN Performance, PEU-RP, is a unit at Ericsson which is at the forefront of 5G development, including application of innovative technologies such as Cloud and Artificial Intelligence.


As a Test Manager in PEU-RP you will as a technical leader drive and define test analysis of new 5G RAN features, for both Purpose built and Cloud RAN deployments, to secure the most efficient and effective test coverage, which ensures product quality and an optimized product flow. Additionally, you will continuously optimize legacy test coverage using several methods for an appropriate risk level. In this context, you will work closely with a wide network including other technical leaders, program organization, product owners, Systems/Design/Test/Customer Support teams etc., and play an active role in inspiring and educating the test community on test strategies and test practices, to secure all the assigned test activities across product test flow are within approved cost, time, and quality frame.  

  

We emphasize team work, communication and co-operation. We expect you to be a strong team player and thereby contribute to the teams’ successes. We expect you to be willing to step forward and take responsibility and actively drive issues as well as taking part in all aspects of the Test Manager role. We also expect you to live by Ericsson core values professionalism, respect, perseverance and integrity. We provide an open working climate and diversity where all opinions and contributions are appreciated as well as a possibility to work with the latest technology telecommunication development.

 **What you will do:**  

1. Drive Test Analysis work of 5G RAN features and products during study and development phases to set and communicate test scope on all levels  

2. Support development teams to follow and adhere to test strategies to ensure timely and cost efficient test  

3. Identify test tools impact and/or risks for new features and products and follow up the implementation  

4. Identify and forecast test environment requirements  

5. Secure that detailed test scope is performed during the execution phase to ensure test coverage and quality  

6. Contribute to test strategies and new test methodologies to enhance test efficiency  

7. Educate and support the organization on test strategy and efficient testing

 **The skills you bring:**  

1. University education M.Sc/B.Sc in Computer science/Telecommunication/Electrical engineering or equivalent experience  

2. Minimum 8 years of experience in 5G RAN development or deployment (e.g., from Systems, Design, Feature Verification, System Verification, CI/CD or Customer Support)  

3. Good understanding of software development and testing processes, including Agile and Waterfall methodologies  

4. Ability to communicate effectively in written and verbal English  

5. Strong problem solving skills to devise innovative solutions for testing challenges and analytical abilities to troubleshoot complex issues  

6. Ability to articulate and convey complex technical information effectively to stakeholders  

7. Ability to lead a group of people and inspire and mentor testing teams  

8. Ability to handle changing requirements and project scopes with a flexible mindset  

9. Advantages for this position: Experience from Test Strategy work, Knowledge in AI and Machine Learning in test, Data driven test management, Next generation software development


We look forward to your application with CV in English. We target 60% work-from-the office.  

Last day to apply is 9th of September 2025. Please note that we do not accept, proceed, or respond for applications sent via e-mail.  

If you have specific questions, you are welcome to contact Muhammad Usman, Manager of Test Management, at muhammad.usman@ericsson.com or Madalina Dinu, Sr. Talent Acquisition Partner at Madalina.a.dinu@ericsson.com

**Why join Ericsson?**


At Ericsson, you´ll have an outstanding opportunity. The chance to use your skills and imagination to push the boundaries of what´s possible. To build solutions never seen before to some of the world’s toughest problems. You´ll be challenged, but you won’t be alone. You´ll be joining a team of diverse innovators, all driven to go beyond the status quo to craft what comes next.  

  

**What happens once you apply?**


Click Here to find all you need to know about what our typical hiring process looks like.


Encouraging a diverse and inclusive organization is core to our values at Ericsson, that's why we champion it in everything we do. We truly believe that by collaborating with people with different experiences we drive innovation, which is essential for our future growth. We encourage people from all backgrounds to apply and realize their full potential as part of our Ericsson team. Ericsson is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. learn more.

**Primary country and city:** Sweden (SE) || Stockholm
